messages.subject: Re: Roblox Re: question about core subjects
messages.msgSnippet: Rick (DH) (ocredbrd1968) sent a friend request last night... He only has two other friends - Joshua (DS) and the Default friend they give you when you sign
messages.messageBody:
Rick (DH) (ocredbrd1968) sent a friend request last night... He only has
two other friends - Joshua (DS) and the "Default" friend they give you
when you sign up.

Deb R

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Roblox Re: question about core subjects
messages.msgSnippet: It would show up on My ROblox page as a badge that says Builders Club that is all! So he would have to notice the badge and not outside ads. The inside
messages.messageBody:
It would show up on My ROblox page as a badge that says Builders Club that is all!
So he would have to notice the badge and not outside ads. The inside Roblox ads would still be there but no outside ones.
So not something really flashy.
If you want him to notice just tell him to look at his badges.
 
Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/
 




________________________________
From: Debra Rossing <debra.rossing@...>
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, December 18, 2008 8:21:17 AM
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Roblox Re: question about core subjects


THANKS! - we can log in on DH's laptop. Would he have to log out and
back in to see the upgrade or would it pop up all of a sudden while he's
playing?

Deb R

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Roblox Re: question about core subjects
messages.msgSnippet: I can send them a friend request. I have played a lot of Roblox! Oh and just log in on another computer ( even if he is on in his laptop- its OK I do it all
messages.messageBody:
I can send them a friend request. I have played a lot of Roblox!
Oh and just log in on another computer ( even if he is on in his laptop- its OK I do it all the time to read messages or send friend requests when he is in a game)
and upgrade from there. The only thing you cannot do is try to  go in a game while he is in a game- that will kick his cahracther off  but to just go in to upgrade to builders club is fine!He wll never know you were log in on another computer.

 
Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Roblox Re: question about core subjects
messages.msgSnippet: Look for starbloxx - that s DS. I think DH is ocredbrd (as usual, his nickname in college was Red Beard because of his distinctive reddish beard duh that s
messages.messageBody:
Look for starbloxx - that's DS. I think DH is ocredbrd (as usual, his
nickname in college was Red Beard because of his distinctive reddish
beard duh that's probably obvious lol) I don't know how it all works to
go about finding people on Roblox and sending friend requests or
whatever.

DS is getting an upgrade to Builder's Club for Christmas ... must
convince him somehow not to take his laptop up to bed with him that
night. Getting him to go up to bed instead of staying downstairs all
night is easy - I'm setting up his presents as a treasure hunt and he
doesn't want to see where I hide things. BUT if he heads upstairs, he
often takes his laptop along and plays up there all night (wireless
networks are excellent!) Gotta convince him to just leave his laptop
downstairs somehow so we can upgrade him without him knowing until the
next morning...I'm going to wrap a little Lego person with a note to go
check Roblox. That'll be the last thing on the treasure hunt because
once he gets to that, nothing else will happen lol

Deb R
